words.definition: A citizen is someone who lives in a certain town or city.
words.example: Carlos was born in Spain. He is a Spanish citizen.

words.definition: A council is a group of people who run a city or town.
words.example: The council met to discuss the new laws for the city.

words.definition: To declare is to say something officially.
words.example: I declared my love for him.

words.definition: When people or things are enormous, they are very large.
words.example: My dog looks enormous next to the cat.

words.definition: When something is extraordinary, it is very strange or special.
words.example: He has an extraordinary talent for painting.

words.definition: Fog is a thick cloud that is near the ground.
words.example: I couldn't see anything because of the fog.

words.definition: A funeral is a ceremony that is held for a person who has died.
words.example: Many people went to his funeral.

words.definition: If something is giant, it is very, very big.
words.example: The giant mountain rose high into the sky.

words.definition: An impression is a way of thinking about a person or place.
words.example: My first impression of the city was very good.

words.definition: Income is the money that a person gets for working.
words.example: He has a high income from his job.

words.definition: If someone is mad, they are crazy or very angry.
words.example: The man was mad because someone stole his car.

words.definition: Ought is used to say that something is the right thing to do.
words.example: You ought to help your mother.

words.definition: To resist is to fight against something or someone.
words.example: The army resisted the attack.

words.definition: To reveal is to show something that was hidden.
words.example: He revealed his secret to me.

words.definition: To rid is to make a place or person free from something.
words.example: I want to get rid of my old clothes.

words.definition: A sword is a long, sharp weapon.
words.example: The knight used his sword to fight the dragon.

words.definition: A tale is a story.
words.example: She told us a tale about a magic castle.

words.definition: To trap is to catch something in a device.
words.example: The boy trapped a bird in a cage.

words.definition: A trial is a legal process to see if someone did something bad.
words.example: The trial lasted for two weeks.

words.definition: When something is violent, it is forceful and hurtful.
words.example: The movie was very violent.
